HEA_composition.catalyst_name: OHEA-mNC (ordered HEA on N-rich mesoporous carbon)

key_steps.step1: Formation of metal–catecholamine (MC)/PEO-b-PMMA composite monomicelles in THF–water/ethanol
key_steps.step2: Anchoring monomicelles onto GO via electrostatic interaction and PDA polymerization
key_steps.step3: Calcination in NH3 to obtain ordered HEA (OHEA-mNC)
key_steps.control: Calcination in N2 yields disordered HEA (DHEA-mNC)

synthesis.note: Exact annealing temperature/time are not explicitly specified in the main text

TEM.dispersion: HEA nanoparticles evenly dispersed without obvious aggregation

EDS_mapping.distribution: Homogeneous distribution of Co, Fe, Ni, Cu, Pd

XRD.ordered_phase: Additional (100) and (110) reflections of L12 Fe3Pd-type phase

Raman.implication: Higher defect density after NH3 treatment

electrochemical_performance.electron_transfer_number: ≈4.0 (0.3–0.5 V by K-L analysis and RRDE)

mass_activity.enhancement: 5.4× vs OHEA-nNC; 12× vs DHEA-mNC; 10× vs Pt/C

stability.post_test_structure: L12 order largely retained (≈91% ordered fraction after cycling)

theoretical_computations.stability: OHEA has lower total energy than DHEA (more robust structure)

electronic_structure.Pd_5d_Cu_3d: deep bands (~ −3 eV), act as electron reservoir
electronic_structure.Fe_3d_Co_3d: dominate above Fermi level (electron depletion centers)
electronic_structure.key_feature: Co 3d in OHEA is closer to Fermi level than in DHEA

theoretical_computations.O2_adsorption: Both phases show orbital shifts indicating strong O2–surface interaction; stronger facilitation in OHEA

site_dependent_PDOS.surface_vs_bulk: Pd and Cu shift toward Fermi level at surface
site_dependent_PDOS.interpretation: Clear task partition among lattice sites enables high ORR efficiency
